Consist of approximately 800 pages of lectures, lecture notes, and research notes, much of which pertain to courses taught by
Material is typescript and holograph. Research notes follow lecture notes, fragmentary material is found last.

Material includes holograph and typescript notes and essays on Paul, Mark, and Jesus. There is an untitled typescript paper, 6 chapters in length on Paul. Material also includes the text of the Pauline letters. The studies in Mark consist of 5, and numerous lectures on the gospel of Mark which were given in the rural church school of Vanderbilt University in 1928, 1935, 1936. The studies about Jesus consist of 5 typescript, carbon sections of 3 pages each.

Include expository notes, explanations and outlines for the uniform lessons. Subject matter consists of miscellaneous studies in both Old and New Testaments. Material is mostly typescript and carbon copies.

Include reader's reports on 2 of Hawkin's works, The Recovery of the Historical Paul, and The Rise of the Old Testament. Also included is a paper written by Dechard Henry Turner, Jr., for New Testament seminar, titled The Correlation of the Key Scriptural Reference Used by Contemporary Scholarship In Its Reconstruction of the Pauline Gospel With Our Categories of "Spurious" and "Genuine" Materials, and a final examination paper by J. E. Sellers, dated March 25, 1955. Material is mostly typescript, some carbon copies.

Include 1 offprint, 2 reprints, and 1 preprint. Arranged alphabetically by title. Some are autographed by the author. Divine Kingship in the Ancient Near East; A review article, by Theodore H. Gaster; How Well Did the Synoptic Evangelists Know the Synagogue?, by Sylvan D. Schwartzman; In History or Beyond History, by C. C. McCown; Thirty Years of New Testament Study, by C. H. Dodd.

Includes the annual reports if the Southwest Missouri Conference of the Methodist Episcopal Church, 1910 - 1918; Several church programs; a typescript carbon copy of a plan to establish a memorial collection in the JUL in honor of the parents of Robert Martyr Hawkins; a transcript from the records of the Vanderbilt School of Religion of the credits of R. M. Hawkins 1907 - 1910; Cash account kept on Hawkins while in Edinburgh; syllabus for courses for the School of Missions; course evaluation written by students of Hawkins; magazine clippings; publishers' announcement.
